stem: The most common site of local gonococcal infection in females is
disc:
Gonorrhea and Chlamydia are sexually transmitted infections causing cervicitis. In addition, both might cause Pelvic Inflammatory Disease.

Disseminated gonococcal infection can present as polyarticular involvement, tenosynovitis, and rash.
tags: Gynaecology, Infectious Disease, Sexually Transmitted Infection
